trans-unit.source: Because of ongoing development, the Android SDK version installed in Android Studio might not match the version in the code.
trans-unit.target: Because of ongoing development, the Android SDK version installed in Android Studio might not match the version in the code.

trans-unit.source: The Android SDK referenced in this tutorial is version 21, the latest at the time of writing.
trans-unit.target: The Android SDK referenced in this tutorial is version 21, the latest at the time of writing.

trans-unit.source: The version number may increase as new releases of the SDK appear, and we recomend using the latest version available.
trans-unit.target: The version number may increase as new releases of the SDK appear, and we recomend using the latest version available.

trans-unit.source: Two symptoms of version mismatch are:
trans-unit.target: Two symptoms of version mismatch are:

trans-unit.source: When you Build or Rebuild the project, you may get Gradle error messages like "**failed to find target Google Inc.:Google APIs:n**".
trans-unit.target: When you Build or Rebuild the project, you may get Gradle error messages like "**failed to find target Google Inc.:Google APIs:n**".

trans-unit.source: Standard Android objects in code that should resolve based on `import` statements may be generating error messages.
trans-unit.target: Standard Android objects in code that should resolve based on `import` statements may be generating error messages.

trans-unit.source: If either of these appear, the version of the Android SDK installed in Android Studio might not match the SDK target of the downloaded project.
trans-unit.target: If either of these appear, the version of the Android SDK installed in Android Studio might not match the SDK target of the downloaded project.

trans-unit.source: To verify the version, make the following changes:
trans-unit.target: To verify the version, make the following changes:

trans-unit.source: If you have not installed the latest version of the SDK Platform, then click to install it.
trans-unit.target: If you have not installed the latest version of the SDK Platform, then click to install it.

trans-unit.source: Make a note of the version number.
trans-unit.target: Make a note of the version number.

trans-unit.source: In the Project Explorer tab, under **Gradle Scripts**, open the file **build.gradle (modeule: app)**.
trans-unit.target: In the Project Explorer tab, under **Gradle Scripts**, open the file **build.gradle (modeule: app)**.

trans-unit.source: Ensure that the **compileSdkVersion** and **buildToolsVersion** are set to the latest SDK version installed.
trans-unit.target: Ensure that the **compileSdkVersion** and **buildToolsVersion** are set to the latest SDK version installed.

trans-unit.source: The tags might look like this:
trans-unit.target: The tags might look like this:

trans-unit.source: In the Android Studio Project Explorer right-click the project node, choose **Properties**, and in the left column choose **Android**.
trans-unit.target: In the Android Studio Project Explorer right-click the project node, choose **Properties**, and in the left column choose **Android**.

trans-unit.source: Ensure that the **Project Build Target** is set to the same SDK version as the **targetSdkVersion**.
trans-unit.target: Ensure that the **Project Build Target** is set to the same SDK version as the **targetSdkVersion**.

trans-unit.source: In Android Studio, the manifest file is no longer used to specify the target SDK and minimum SDK version, unlike the case with Eclipse.
trans-unit.target: In Android Studio, the manifest file is no longer used to specify the target SDK and minimum SDK version, unlike the case with Eclipse.
